definition: to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
divinatory diagram/one of the eight divinatory trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]/one of the sixty-four divinatory hexagrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]

sentences.english: A tentative agreement struck on Thursday evaporated after a revolt by House Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 週四，由於共和黨變卦，一份臨時協議被撤銷。

sentences.english: If he backs out of the deal, you can sue him.
sentences.chinese: 他如果變卦取消交易，你就起訴他。

sentences.english: Did your goals change in midstream ?
sentences.chinese: 您的目標有沒有中途變卦？

sentences.english: You promised you would help, so you can't back out of it now.
sentences.chinese: 你答應過要幫我的，所以你現在不能變卦。

definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to force someone to do something
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
